author: Grayvem
title: Inability to Add Multiple Guests in Division Rivals - Answer HQ
text:
Product : EA SPORTS FC 25
Platform : Xbox Series X
Please specify your platform model. Microsoft Xbox Series X
What is your Gamertag/PSN ID/Switch ID? Gr4yven
Which mode has this happened in? Ultimate Team™
Which part of the mode? Rivals
Can you tell us the date (MM/DD/YYYY) that you saw the bug? 1/8/24
What time did you see the bug? (HH:MM AM/PM) 12:00 m
What is your time zone? GMT (UTC)
How often does the bug occur? Every time (100%)
Steps: How can we find the bug ourselves? To reproduce the issue, follow these steps on an Xbox Series X: Launch EA SPORTS FC 25 and enter the Division Rivals mode. Connect a second controller and attempt to add a second guest to the match (in addition to the main user and the first guest). You will notice that the game does not allow adding more than one guest. It only recognizes the main player and the first guest, rejecting any attempt to add a second or third guest.
What happens when the bug occurs? When the bug occurs, the game does not allow adding a second guest to the Division Rivals match. After connecting a second controller and attempting to add another guest, the option to include more players is unavailable, and the system only recognizes the main user and the first guest.
What should be happening instead? The game should allow adding up to three guests, enabling a total of four players (the main user plus three guests) to participate in Division Rivals matches, as was possible on previous consoles like PlayStation 4.
‌
In both editions of EA FC , 24 and 25 , on Xbox Series X , I have not been able to add a second guest to the matches, something I could easily do on PS4 without any issues.
It doesn’t seem fair that Xbox users don’t have access to a feature that is available on other platforms. We are paying the same price for the game and deserve the same quality of experience. I hope this can be resolved soon.
